title: Unbelievable Chicken Recipe
description: Your taste buds will thrill to this exciting blend of sweet and sour. Grilled chicken never tasted better or more juicy!
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Meat and Poultry Chicken Chicken Breast Healthy Chicken Unbelievable Chicken 4.5 (2,423) 1,722 Reviews 98 Photos This unusual combination of common ingredients is fabulous! Everyone who tastes it asks me to share the recipe. You will love it and the many compliments you get--I promise! Submitted by Ruth Phillips Updated on November 16, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 98 98 98 98 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Additional Time: 8 hrs 25 mins Total Time: 9 hrs Servings: 6 Yield: 6 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings ¼ cup cider vinegar 3 tablespoons prepared coarse-ground mustard 3 cloves garlic, peeled and minced 1 lime, juiced ½ lemon, juiced ½ cup brown sugar 1 ½ teaspoons salt ground black pepper to taste 6 tablespoons olive oil 6 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves Directions In a large glass bowl, mix the cider vinegar, mustard, garlic, lime juice, lemon juice, brown sugar, salt, and pepper. Whisk in the olive oil. Place chicken in the mixture. Cover, and marinate 8 hours, or overnight. Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat. Lightly oil the grill grate. Place chicken on the prepared grill, and cook 6 to 8 minutes per side, until juices run clear. Discard marinade. Scott Fitzgerald Editor's Note: The nutrition data for this recipe includes information for the full amount of the marinade ingredients. Depending on marinating time, ingredients, cook time, etc., the actual amount of the marinade consumed will vary. I Made It Print 3,385 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 337 Calories 16g Fat 22g Carbs 25g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 6 Calories 337 % Daily Value * Total Fat 16g 21% Saturated Fat 3g 14% Cholesterol 67mg 22% Sodium 736mg 32% Total Carbohydrate 22g 8% Dietary Fiber 1g 3% Total Sugars 18g Protein 25g 50% Vitamin C 11mg 12% Calcium 42mg 3% Iron 1mg 7% Potassium 269mg 6% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Unbelievable Chicken 01 of 98 Photo by  Scott Fitzgerald 02 of 98 Photo by  brianrammdammit 06/18/2022 Easy and excellent-what more could you ask for? 03 of 98 Photo by  Scott Fitzgerald 02/02/2021 04 of 98 Photo by  Supertruckingirl 12/18/2019 Super delicious! I don't have a grill so I baked the chicken breasts then super heated a pan until smoking and blackened the chicken 1 minute on each side. I reduced the left over marinade and chicken juices (from baking) into a glaze which was an ultra flavourful and a delicious addition! I chose to stuff my chicken with jalapeno Monterey Jack cheese which was ok but I'm thinking next time I'd like to go with a sharp aged cheese if I stuff again. 05 of 98 Photo by  Gabi 09/09/2018 06 of 98 Photo by  Chef Mo 06/21/2018 Love that I had everything on hand! Quick and easy marinade recipe. Basted while it was on the grill. Loved the light hint of brown sugar to the flavor! 07 of 98 Photo by  Tiffany Chancey 11/13/2017 08 of 98 Photo by  Nicole Espinoza 09/01/2017 Wow!!! My husband loved it and he is usually a salt and pepper only kind of guy!! I used thighs, and didn't have cider vinegar so I used red wine vinegar instead. Juicy, sweet, tangy, the charred pieces were heaven. Going in the use this frequently recipe bin! 09 of 98 Photo by  Gina Christian 06/27/2017 Wow!! This is the BEST chicken marinade ever!! I followed exactly as stated and George foreman grilled the sliced breasts - in love!! Many thanks 10 of 98 Photo by  Suresh Chowdary Paladugu 06/23/2017 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Key West Chicken 1,574 Ratings Hawaiian Chicken Pineapple Kabobs 798 Ratings RamJam Chicken 390 Ratings Spicy Chicken Breasts 704 Ratings Memorial Day Best BBQ Chicken Ever! 50 Ratings Honey Mustard Grilled Chicken 2,589 Ratings Chicken Kabobs 59 Ratings Marinated Greek Chicken Kabobs 314 Ratings Cornell Chicken 85 Ratings Ray's Chicken 273 Ratings Greek Chicken 495 Ratings Grilled Chicken Foil Packets 48 Ratings Chef John's Barbecue Chicken 162 Ratings Jamaican Jerk Chicken 111 Ratings Juicy Grilled Chicken Breasts 504 Ratings New York Finger Lakes Chicken 11 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Ruth Phillips
instructions: In a large glass bowl, mix the cider vinegar, mustard, garlic, lime juice, lemon juice, brown sugar, salt, and pepper. Whisk in the olive oil. Place chicken in the mixture. Cover, and marinate 8 hours, or overnight.;Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat.;Lightly oil the grill grate. Place chicken on the prepared grill, and cook 6 to 8 minutes per side, until juices run clear. Discard marinade. Scott Fitzgerald
